chapter.title: Input Fields 2
chapter.para: What if there is no author or editor - no name to input? There is no delete button on the Basic Input Forms, for none is needed, since empty frames or fields do not show up in the output. Therefore: if something does not apply to the publication you are cataloguing, just leave the frame or field in question blank. The input options should fit most cases, but there are many variants, so often you will just have to leave a field or frame empty.

If, on the contrary, you want extra input options, you should access the more advanced input forms: on the Name Info tab, e.g., you will be able to dissect a name into more than two name parts and you will be able to attach more types to these, such as "Terms of Address" and "Date". Also, though it is hard to believe, there are more roles to choose from on the Name Info tab.

Taking the plunge to use the "real" input forms may in some cases have the effect that your record does not show up in the Basic Input Forms. The Basic Input Forms are keyed to a small set of options set when you choose a record template, and if they are changed, you will have to continue editing your record outside the Basic Input Forms. In most case, this will not happen.
